name: Company Culture
description: Across these episodes, “Company Culture” is treated as an operating system: the set of values, mechanisms, and day-to-day behaviors that determine how decisions get made, how teams collaborate, and what quality bar the company can sustain at scale. The theme repeatedly asks how leaders intentionally shape culture (vs. letting it drift), how culture shows up in execution (hiring, feedback, meetings, metrics), and how to preserve speed and ownership while growing headcount, complexity, and stakes.
subtopics: Culture as mechanisms, not slogans: which rituals/processes (e.g., decision docs, meeting norms, ownership models) actually encode values
High-velocity execution vs. sustainable teams: maintaining intensity, quality bars, and accountability without burning out or creating fear
Psychological safety and candor: how feedback, disagreement, and vulnerability enable better decisions and stronger relationships
Empowerment and ownership at scale: org design patterns (single-threaded leaders, embedded PMs, “coaches not managers”) that keep teams autonomous
Mission and ethics as cultural constraints: aligning metrics and incentives with purpose (journalism, entrepreneurship, safety/alignment) to avoid local optimization
Cross-functional trust (PM/Eng/Ops/Design): behaviors that reduce friction, improve collaboration, and prevent credit-hoarding or “telephone PM” dynamics
common_frameworks: OKRs as a quarterly alignment + learning cadence (and the prerequisite of psychological safety)
High talent density + high bar hiring as a cultural flywheel
Feedback systems: candid performance conversations, relationship “reality” checks, and meeting-close alignment questions
